item.title: Israel declares emergency in Lod as unrest spreads
item.description: Riots sweep Lod as unrest grows after days of fighting between Israel and Palestinian militants.

item.title: UK economy shrank by 1.5% in first quarter
item.description: The UK economy shrank by 1.5% in the first quarter of 2021, as the country experienced a lengthy winter lockdown.

item.title: Government lays out plans to protect users online
item.description: The Online Safety Bill threatens media giants with big fines - but aims to protect political debate.

item.title: The Brits 2021: Great show, shame about the videos
item.description: Fans say they loved seeing live music again, but weren't so keen on the pre-taped performances.

item.title: Blackpool boy, 9, killed in lightning strike on playing field
item.description: The boy, who was taking part in a football coaching session, was taken to hospital but did not survive.

item.title: Universities could face fines over free speech breaches
item.description: Universities in England could face fines if they fail to protect free speech on campus under new legislation.

item.title: Lockdown: Six people can meet in pubs in Wales from Monday
item.description: The Welsh government announces extra funding for hospitality businesses still affected.

item.title: Angela Rayner: People didn't know what Keir Starmer stood for
item.description: Labour's deputy leader says she believes in the party leader "100%" after being moved to a new role.

item.title: India coronavirus: 'My city is under siege from Covid'
item.description: The BBC's Vikas Pandey has called Delhi home for more than a decade - but Covid has changed everything.

item.title: Liverpool City Council: Staff at council feared speaking out
item.description: Government inspector Max Caller says staff at Liverpool City Council felt intimidated to speak out.

item.title: Violent crime falls sharply during Covid lockdown - study
item.description: Researchers gathered data on violence-related injuries from 133 NHS centres in England and Wales.

item.title: The papers: Queen's Speech 'backlash' and Fred West cops dig
item.description: Many papers react to the Queen's Speech as some report on a search for possible victim of Fred West.

item.title: Brits 2021 winners: Dua Lipa, Little Mix, Taylor Swift win on a big night for female acts
item.description: Big winner Dua Lipa joined other stars including Little Mix and Arlo Parks for the in-person ceremony.

item.title: Female football fans share experiences of abuse
item.description: Meliza and Kendall are dedicated football fans but say they experience abuse because of their gender.

item.title: Covid: Medic memorial statue unveiled ahead of final finish
item.description: The BBC is given a view of the first figure on the planned national emergency services memorial.

item.title: Furniture Poverty: millions living without essential items
item.description: In the UK more than two million people experience furniture povert yet it’s rarely spoken about.

item.title: Freemasons: Young people 'on waiting lists' to join notoriously secretive society
item.description: The first report by Freemasons in 300 years shows it is popular with young people.

item.title: Bob Marley: 40th anniversary of the music pioneer's death
item.description: The reggae music legend died of cancer in 1981 aged just 36.

item.title: Vesuvius ancient eruption rescuer identified at Herculaneum, says expert
item.description: A body found at Herculaneum may have been part of Pliny the Elder's team sent to rescue residents.

item.title: 'Sea kayaking helps my recovery from depression'
item.description: Nick Ray says he finds relief on the sea, enjoying close encounters with seals and dolphins.

item.title: How to get Bangladeshi men talking about mental health
item.description: Bangladeshi men in the UK are being encouraged to talk about the effects the pandemic has had on them.

item.title: Accessibility and outdoor socialising: 'I feel unwelcome in my own city'
item.description: Pippa Stacey, 26, faces "all kinds of obstacles" as venues sprawl on to pavements.

item.title: What are Eid and Ramadan and when are they?
item.description: Ramadan is one of the most important events in the Islamic calendar, but it's been affected by lockdown.

item.title: How Italy's healthcare staff survived the pandemic
item.description: Nurses in Italy have been instrumental in helping to fight Covid-19 - but it's taken a heavy toll.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Master every aspect of your business'
item.description: Windfarm CEO Sarah Merrick says being involved in all areas of her business has paid dividends.

item.title: Pep Guardiola: How Manchester City boss reinvented Premier League title winners
item.description: Pep Guardiola learned from previous errors to renew his Manchester City side for the better, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: Budget: Australia tries to win back women with childcare boost
item.description: The government's new budget boosts childcare and women's health, but critics say more reform is needed.

item.title: Israel-Palestinians: Old grievances fuel new fighting
item.description: Failure to tackle deep-seated issues meant fresh violence between the two sides was a matter of time.

item.title: The volunteers using 'honeypot' groups to fight anti-vax propaganda
item.description: Volunteers are busting anti-vaccine conspiracy theories with decoy Facebook groups.

item.title: Northern Ireland abortion: Real lives behind new drama
item.description: Lola Petticrew plays a pregnant schoolgirl whose mum faces prosecution after buying abortion pills.

item.title: Mind-boggling magnets could unlock plentiful power
item.description: Powerful magnets are bringing abundant, pollution-free electricity a step closer.

item.title: Biloela family: Locked up by Australia for three years
item.description: Two young girls and their asylum seeker parents remain in detention despite years of campaigning.

item.title: Love Has Won: Family's grief at death of mummified cult leader
item.description: Police in Colorado say the body of Amy Carlson was mishandled, leaving her family appalled.

item.title: Covid: DR Congo in race against time to vaccinate people
item.description: In one of Africa's largest countries, people worry more about security and other diseases than Covid-19.

item.title: Mental health: Can you tell if someone is struggling?
item.description: Coronavirus has affected many people in different ways - how would you react if someone needed support?

item.title: Colonial hack: How did cyber-attackers shut off pipeline?
item.description: Attacks on critical national infrastructure are an increasing concern, experts say.

item.title: 'This was the hardest one' - Guardiola praises players as Man City win Premier League
item.description: Manchester City win a third Premier League title in four years after closest challengers Manchester United lose to Leicester City.

item.title: ‘We’ve never seen anything like this before’ – Richards on how Man City won Premier League title
item.description: 'Pep Guardiola's system, and a few surprises' - BBC pundit Micah Richards explains what lies behind Manchester City's third Premier League title in four years.

item.title: Anthony Joshua v Tyson Fury: Fight to take place in Saudi Arabia, says Eddie Hearn
item.description: Anthony Joshua and Tyson Fury's world heavyweight title fight will take place in Saudi Arabia, says Joshua's promoter Eddie Hearn.

item.title: NBA: Miami Heat beat Boston Celtics to secure play-off spot, Los Angeles Lakers win
item.description: The Miami Heat secure a play-off spot with a 129-121 win at the Boston Celtics that all but condemns the Celtics to the newly established play-in tournament.

item.title: Ings double seals Southampton fightback
item.description: Danny Ings scores twice as Southampton fightback to beat Crystal Palace in an entertaining Premier League affair.

item.title: La Liga: Lionel Messi scores volley as Levante hold Barcelona in six-goal thriller
item.description: Watch highlights as Barcelona drop points in the La Liga title race following an entertaining 3-3 draw against Levante, despite Lionel Messi scoring a brilliant first-half volley.

item.title: Queen's Speech 2021: Key points at-a-glance
item.description: New laws on housing, animal welfare and elections feature in the government's plans for next year.

item.title: The Queen's Speech - what you need to know in two minutes
item.description: Didn't catch Her Majesty outlining the government's plans for the year? Don't worry, we got you.

item.title: Queen's Speech: How this year broke with traditions
item.description: There were some notable breaks with tradition this year as the Queen formally opened Parliament.

item.title: Animal welfare plan unveiled by government
item.description: The UK government introduces a wide-ranging plan to improve the welfare of some animals.

item.title: Queen's Speech: Government makes pledges on animal welfare
item.description: All creatures great and small will be protected in the new proposals, according to the Queen's Speech.

item.title: Conversion therapy ban: Campaigners dismayed over delay
item.description: Campaigners are dismayed as the government announces a consultation before the practice is banned.

item.title: Queen's Speech 2021: Pomp and pageantry pared back
item.description: Instead of the normal pomp and pageantry, this year saw ceremonial aspects pared back due to coronavirus.

item.title: Freeports: What are they and where will they be?
item.description: Further details about England's new freeports were announced in the Queen's Speech.

item.title: The Queen's Speech in full
item.description: Queen Elizabeth ll opens Parliament, setting out the government's plans.

item.title: What is levelling up and how is it going?
item.description: The government is promising to take more action on levelling up this year.

item.title: Queen's Speech commits to Troubles legislation
item.description: New legislation to deal with the Troubles legacy will be set out in the coming weeks.

item.title: Queen's Speech: What is it and why is it important?
item.description: The Queen's Speech is on Tuesday.

item.title: Voting: Could ID checks affect who participates in elections?
item.description: The government says it will pass a law requiring identification to vote.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Lockdown restrictions will ease significantly in England and Scotland from Monday 17 May.

item.title: Which countries are on the green list for foreign holidays?
item.description: Scotland is to adopt the same "traffic light" system for foreign travel as England.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 40 or over in England are now being offered a Covid vaccine as the rollout continues.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: Secondary school pupils in England will no longer be required to wear them in class from next week.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules and the rule of six?
item.description: Hugs between friends and family who don't live together will be allowed under guidance in England from 17 May.

item.title: Restaurants and pubs are reopening inside, but what are the rules?
item.description: People in England, Scotland and Wales will soon be able to drink inside a pub.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the Covid-19 alert level system work?
item.description: The threat of Covid-19 in England is ranked through a five-level, colour-coded alert system.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 35 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the plans for the NHS app?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: Quarantine-free overseas holidays will be possible after 17 May, but what rights do you have if plans or rules change?
